Jaundice
 The yellow coloration of the white of the eyes and skin is a symptom called jaundice. 
The most common cause of jaundice is liver disease called hepatitis, caused by viral 
infection. These viruses most often get into the body through eating and drinking infected food and water. This disease occurs commonly in the hot weather and the rainy season, such as diarrhoea and cholera. The viruses that cause jaundice can 
also enter the body through unsafe injections given by unsterilized syringes and
